PROJECT DESCRIPTION: Installation of an aeration system and mixing system in the  primary elevated water storage tanks and automated flushing hydrants.
Abandon the dilapidated surface water treatment plant, develop 2  new wells, construct a new water treatment plant, and replace the majority of our distribution system to meet ODEQ regulations.
Improvements to the raw water intake, treatment plant, and/or  distribution system to address the DBP exceedances occurring within the system.
Installation of a tank mixing system in the existing elevated tank  to assist in reduction of DBPs.
Construct a Treatment Plant for Nitrate Removal.
Water treatment improvements for reduction of disinfection by- products.
Construct a composite elevated storage tank with tank aeration  for the removal of THMs.

Addition of a third "Actifloc" clarification/filtration unit at the  existing RWD #4 water treatment plant; installation of a 500,000 gallon water storage tank at the existing RWD #4 treatment  plant, and construct a two-mile long twelve-inch (12") water line project on S. 4100 Road, located near Talala, OK.
Construct one new Ion Exchange nitrate reduction water  treatment plant, two new distribution standpipes, and install eight new well pumps.

Installation of a 24-inch Water Line project along E. 33rd Street  from east of S. Broadway/Highway 77 to I-35.  The water system improvements will increase distribution reliability, boost pressure  and loop into other existing water lines.
Expansion of the water treatment plant.
Raw Water and Finished Water Transmission Mains (MAIN-03);  AI-35 Complex Storage Improvements (TANK-02).
WTP Rehabilitation and Improvements:  New chemical building,  new filters, new recarb., rehabilitation/expand chlorine system.
Upgrades to the water treatment plant which will incllude a new  clarifier, controls upgrade and the adition of aeration at the plant clearwell and distribution storage.
Improvements to reduce Disinfection By-Products (DBPs).
Design, engineering, and construction of a new water treatment  plant intended to replace an existing plant that has been the subject of numerous consent orders for the last several years.
Installing water lines to loop in dead end lines to help with water  age and two (2) booster stations to help with pressure issues.

Replacement of Asbestos Cement (AC) water mains with PVC  pipe, and rehabilitation of an existing standpipe and upgrades include:  spray aeration, inlet/outlet pipe upgrading, forced-air  ventilation, etc. for TTHM non compliance.
Improvements include clearwell modifications and tank aeration;  rehailitation of the existing filters and repainting the steel components in Clarifier 3.
Replacement of the filter media in the slow sand filter, additional  chlorine feed point at the WTP, flushing hydrant, and booster chlorine station in the distribution system.
Install Emergency Generators and Automatic Transfer Switch for  the WTP, and replace a 7.5 HP High Service Pump with a 20 HP pump, and additional items.
Install an elevated storage tank.
Installing a dedicated water line to the standpipe to ensure all  customers receive aerated/recirculated water and DBP compliant water.
Construct a new water treatment plant and appurtenances.
Construct a 350,000-gallon spiracone clarifier and 6 additional  12' filters, and construct a 105 foot, 500,000-gallon elevated tank.
Install an aeration system in the water tower, replace blending  station, repair wellhouse, chlorination machine, and tank level guide repair.
Installation of a permanent Chlorine Dioxide Feed System and a  separate chlorine gas storage/feed building.
Water treatment plant improvements to reduce disinfection by- products.

Construct a second, redundant, clarifier to allow for maintenance  of the existing clarifier; construct a mixing basin along with additional bypass piping; and rehabilitation of the sand filter and  reworking the piping to increase redundancy.
Construction of a WTP Finished Water Pump Station and  Clearwell Replacement.
Installation of an Ion Exchange Treatment Unit, Building and  Wastewater Disposal Storage Facility.
Identification, planning, design, and replacement of lead  distribution  lines.

Construct a new groundwater well to supplement supply;  construct a new elevated water storage tank to provide system storage; and the rehabilitation of an existing standpipe to extend  its functional life.
Water system improvements consisting of water line  replacements, tower mixers and improvements, and pump improvements.

Replacement of approximately 10.5 miles (55,500 feet) of  existing 8" waterline to 12", replacement of approximately 2.15 miles (11,360 feet) of 8" waterline to 10" to resolve all low  pressure issues throughout the system, and the purchase and implementation of a drive-by meter reading system.
Construction of four (4) miles of  12" water line, a water tower  and a pump station, and.5 mile of 10" water line replacement.
Construction to supply water to the community of Delhi,  Oklahoma which has high nitrate levels.

Install a full SCADA automation system for the City's water wells,  treatment plant, and towers; Painting of the Meeker Water Tower; Valve Replacement in the distribution system; and Water  pipe replacement in the distribution system.
Installation of approximately 72,000 L.F. of line replacement and  additional line, a proposed water storage tank, rehabilitation of two standpipes, and a proposed booster station.
Install collection lines to bring the majority of the groundwater  wells to one centralized location, storage tank, pumping station, and distribution lines.
Construction of water mains, booster stations, well  improvements, and water rights acquisition.
Design and construction of two separate water main line  replacements, collectively called the Cache Road Waterline Replacement Project.
Construct a new 5.0 MGD process building, high service pump  station, and a new chemical building.
Purchase and install new water meters, and Phase 1 waterline  replacement.
Construct a 0.9 MG water storage standpipe to improve water  reliability.
Replacement of aging 2 inch cast iron water mains and  associated services. $                                                                         301,669,179.40
Install a new baffled clearwell with new Cl2 feed system and  distribution pumping.
Construction of a new water treatment plant.
Replacement of roughly fifty-five (55) miles of water distribution  mains.
Construction of a one (1) million-gallon elevated storage tank.
Expansion of the existing treatment plant to 2.0 mgd including  new clarifiers, filters, chemical building, and control/lab building.
Construction of a water pipeline between the cities of Clinton and  Weatherford.

Arcadia Lake Water Treatment Plant Expansion, remaining  processes (WTP-01C), new ozone generation system, new preozone pipeline contactor, three (3) new solids contact  clarifiers, two (2) new post ozone contactors, eight (8) new dual media filters, new pretreatment chemical building, new  posttreatment chemical building, and associated electrical, controls, yard piping, paving, and other site improvements  necessary to bring the new processes online and connect to existing processes and infrastructure.
Replacing all of the water lines in the system.
Expansion of the water treatment plant on the existing site.
Upgrading the meter reading system which includes  approximately 5500 meters.
Rehabilitate existing 36" Raw WL, add new 42" parallel Raw WL,  involves major river crossings.
Expand Raw Water Supply PS to 25 MGD.
Terminal Storage Reservoir.

Water line from WTP to 6th Street. Demolish abandoned water treatment plant and clearwell;  construct a new 10" waterline from OOWA supply line to new site at West Evanjoy Street and North Grace Street; Construct a new  duplex 300 gpm pump station with standby power at new site; Construct a new 375,000 gallon water storage tank at new site;  Construct new 40' x 60' maintenance and storage building; Demolish both existing water tanks at Jetton Hill Water Storage  site; Construct a new 350,000 gallon storage tank at Jetton Hill site; Replace Pine Creek Pump Station No. 1 with a new 50 gpm  above ground pump station w/standby power; Construct a new 50,000 gallon water tank; Construct 4" water line from old tank to  new tank; Abandon and demolish Pine Crest Pump Station No. 2; Abandon and demolish Pine Crest Water Tank. Construct a new facility for reuse of wastewater effluent to  supplement the water supply. Install a liner in the water tower. Repair and refurbish two (2) towers; Raw water line replacement  of the 6 inch tranmission line from the Comanche Lake Pump Station to the Water Treatment Plant. Replace a pressure reducing valve an constructing a  Rechloramination and Nitrification Control station. Replace 10,637 LF of waterline on Main Street in the City of  Tonkawa. Installation of approximately 9,000 LF of 12" PVC waterline. Expansion of the existing treatment plant to 2.0 mgd including  new clarifiers, filters, chemical building, and control/lab building. Replacement of the 10-inch waterline crossing the Arkansas  River which is no longer in service due to multiple fractures in the
